title: How to hook up a VCR to an HD TV - Quora

response.answer_text: How do you connect a VCR to an HD TV? Easily. Easiest way is via the aerial lead - connect the RF out of the VCR to the RF in of the TV. Connect the incoming aerial to the RF in on the VCR, and tune the TV’s analogue tuner to the VCR’s output (this is usually ch. 36, but can vary, so you might have to hunt for it). This also gives the lowest quality, but with good equipment you won’t notice - though if your VCR is stereo, you will only hear mono. You can also use the VCR’s RF output to feed other TV’s in the house. Better way, almost as easy - connect the VCR’s ausio and video outputs to the corresponding inputs on your television. Usually this is the red, white and yellow RCA connectors (for left, right and video rspectively). If the VCR is mono, there will be one less. Some VCRs use something else for the video, sometimes a BNC connector or (if it’s an old one) an SO239 (screw) connector. Adaptors from these to RCA are easily available. TVs and VCRs for the European market will have SCART connectors; again, suitable leads and adaptors are available. This will give a bit better quality, including stereo, and save you the bother of finding a free channel if you’ve got a lot of transmissions in your area. Don’t bother with things like A/V to HDMI converters unless you have no option; this will degrade the quality and might not work at all if the VCR’s output is too far out of spec (which they can be). Happy viewing!
